<td width="49%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:49.0%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">Class&nbsp;B Common Stock</font></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>
<td width="49%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:49.0%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">28,933,859</font></p>    </td>   </tr>  </table>
</div>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">Documents Incorporated by Reference - Portions of our definitive Proxy Statement relating to our 2011 Annual Meeting of Shareholders are incorporated by reference into Part&nbsp;III of this Form&nbsp;10-K.&#160; We anticipate that our Proxy Statement will be filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission within 120 days after the end of our fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#TableOfContents" title="Click to go to Table of Contents">Table of Contents</a></font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:3.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:3.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FORWARD-LOOKING STATEMENTS</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">This report includes or incorporates forward-looking statements within the meaning of Section&nbsp;27A of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, and Section&nbsp;21E of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the Exchange Act), and the U.S. Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995.&#160; We have based these forward-looking statements on our current expectations and projections about future events.&#160; These forward-looking statements are subject to risks, uncertainties and assumptions about us, including, among other things, the following risks:</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">General risks</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the impact of changes in national and regional economies and credit and capital markets;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">consumer confidence;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the activities of our competitors;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">terrorist acts of violence or war and other geopolitical events;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Industry risks</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the business conditions of our advertisers particularly in the automotive and service industries;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">competition with other broadcast television stations, radio stations, multi-channel video programming distributors (MVPDs), internet and broadband content providers and other print and media outlets serving in the same markets;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">availability and cost of programming and the continued volatility of networks and syndicators that provide us with programming content;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the effects of the Federal Communications Commission&#146;s (FCC&#146;s) National Broadband Plan and the potential reclamation of some of our broadcasting spectrum;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the effects of governmental regulation of broadcasting or changes in those regulations and court actions interpreting those regulations, including ownership regulations, indecency regulations, retransmission regulations and political or other advertising restrictions;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">labor disputes and legislation and other union activity;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the broadcasting community&#146;s ability to develop a viable mobile digital broadcast television (mobile DTV) strategy and platform and the consumer&#146;s appetite for mobile television;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the operation of low power devices in the broadcast spectrum, which could interfere with our broadcast signals;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the effects of new ratings system technologies including &#147;people meters&#148; and &#147;set-top boxes&#148;, and the ability of such technologies to be a reliable standard that can be used by advertisers;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Risks specific to us</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the effectiveness of our management;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">our ability to attract and maintain local and national advertising;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">our ability to service our substantial debt obligations and operate our business under restrictions contained in our financing agreement;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">our ability to successfully renegotiate retransmission consent agreements;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">our ability to renew our FCC licenses;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">our ability to maintain our affiliation and programming service agreements with our networks and program service providers and at renewal, to successfully negotiate these agreements with favorable terms;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the impact of reverse network compensation payments made by us to networks pursuant to our affiliation agreements requiring compensation for network programming and the resulting negative effect on our operating results;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the popularity of syndicated programming we purchase and network programming that we air;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the strength of ratings for our local news broadcasts including our news sharing arrangements;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">changes in the makeup of the population in the areas where our stations are located;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the successful execution of our multi-channel broadcasting initiatives including mobile DTV; and</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the results of prior year tax audits by taxing authorities.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other matters set forth in this report and other reports filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission, including the <i>Risk Factors</i> set forth in Item 1A of this report may also cause actual results in the future to differ materially from those described in the forward-looking statements.&#160; However, additional factors and risks not currently known to us or that we currently deem immaterial may also cause actual results in the future to differ materially from those described in the forward-looking statements.&#160; You are cautioned not to place undue reliance on any forward-looking statements, which speaks only as of the date on which it is made.&#160; We undertake no obligation to update or revise any forward-looking statements, whether as a result of new information, future events or otherwise.&#160; In light of these risks, uncertainties and assumptions, the forward-looking statements discussed in this report might not occur.</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3<a name="PB_3_145337_5335"></a></font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#TableOfContents" title="Click to go to Table of Contents">Table of Contents</a></font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">PART&nbsp;I</font></b><a name="Parti_171900"></a></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 1.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; BUSINESS</font></b><a name="Item1_Business_145404"></a></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We are a diversified television broadcasting company that owns or provides certain programming, operating or sales services to more television stations than most other commercial broadcasting groups in the United States.&#160; We currently own, provide programming and operating services pursuant to local marketing agreements (LMAs) or provide (or are provided) sales services pursuant to outsourcing agreements to 58 television stations in 35 markets.&#160; For the purpose of this report, these 58 stations are referred to as &#147;our&#148; stations.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have a mid-size market focus and 44 of our 58 stations are located in television designated market areas (DMAs) that rank between the 14</font><font size="1" style="font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-3.0pt;">th</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;and 77</font><font size="1" style="font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-3.0pt;">th</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;largest in the United States.&#160; Our broadcast group is a single reportable segment for accounting purposes and includes the following network affiliations: FOX (20 stations); MyNetworkTV (16 stations; as of September&nbsp;2009 is no longer a network affiliation, however is branded as such); ABC (9 stations); The CW (10 stations); CBS (2 stations) and NBC (1 station).&#160; In addition, certain stations broadcast programming on second and third digital signals through network affiliation or program service arrangements with TheCoolTV, The Country Network, MyNetworkTV, This TV and Estrella TV.&#160; Refer to our <i>Markets and Stations </i>table later in this Item 1 for more information.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We broadcast free over-the-air programming to television viewing audiences in the communities we serve through our local television stations.&#160; The programming that we provide on our primary station channels consists of network provided programs, news produced locally, local sporting events, programming from program service arrangements and syndicated entertainment programs.&#160; We produce news at 18 stations in 12 markets, including three stations where we produce news pursuant to a local news sharing arrangement with a competitive station in that market.&#160; We have 13 stations which have local news sharing arrangements with a competitive station in that market that produces the news aired on our station.&#160; We provide live local sporting events on many of our stations by acquiring the local television broadcast rights for these events.&#160; In 2010, we renewed our network affiliation agreements with ABC and FOX.&#160; Pursuant to the renewal agreements, we are required to pay ABC and FOX a fee for the network programming.&#160; Additionally, we purchase and barter for popular syndicated programming from third parties.&#160; See <i>Operating Strategy</i> later in this Item 1 for more information regarding the programming we provide.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our primary source of revenue is the sale of commercial inventory on our television stations to our advertising customers.&#160; Our objective is to meet the needs of our advertising customers by delivering significant audiences in key demographics.&#160; Our strategy is to achieve this objective by providing quality local news programming and popular network and syndicated programs to our viewing audience.&#160; We attract our national television advertisers through a single national marketing representation firm which has offices in New York City, Los Angeles, Chicago and Atlanta.&#160; Our local television advertisers are attracted through the use of a local sales force at each of our television stations, which is comprised of approximately 320 sales account executives company-wide.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Over the last few years, we have been earning revenue from our retransmission consent agreements through payments from the MVPDs in our markets.&#160; The MVPDs are local cable companies, satellite television and local telecommunication video providers.&#160; The revenues primarily represent payments from the MVPDs for access to our digital signal so they may rebroadcast directly to and charge their subscribers.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our operating results are subject to seasonal fluctuations.&#160; The second and fourth quarter operating results are typically higher than the first and third quarters due to increased advertising revenues.&#160; The second quarter operating results are typically higher than the first and third quarters primarily because advertising expenditures are increased in anticipation of consumer spending on &#147;summer related&#148; items such as home improvements, lawn care and travel plans.&#160; The fourth quarter operating results are typically higher than first and third quarters due to anticipation of holiday season spending by consumers.&#160; Due to the economic downturn in 2009, our seasonal fluctuations strayed from the norm and our second quarter net time sales, which includes the advertising portion of our local and national revenues, were lower than our first quarter results.&#160; In 2010, as the economy started to stabilize and recover, our seasonal fluctuations returned to normal. Our operating results are usually subject to cyclical fluctuations from political advertising.&#160; In the past, political spending has been significantly higher in the even-number years due to the cyclicality of political advertising.&#160; Because of the political election cyclicality, there has been a significant difference in our operating results when comparing even-numbered years&#146; performance to the odd numbered years&#146; performance.&#160; In addition, every four years, political spending is typically elevated further due to the advertising revenue preceding the presidential election.&#160; Due to the contentious mid-term elections in 2010, our political revenues in 2010 not only exceeded 2006 results, but exceeded 2008 presidential election year revenues as well.&#160; The Supreme Court&#146;s decision in 2010 to eliminate restrictions on political advertising limits for corporations and unions is likely to increase the levels of political advertising. Additionally, as political-activism around social, political, economic and environmental causes continues to draw attention, political advertising levels may increase further yet.&#160; We believe political advertising will continue to be a strong advertising category in our industry.</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4<a name="PB_4_145722_5796"></a></font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='4',FILE='C:\JMS\mfranka\11-2081-1\task4533662\2081-1-ba-03.htm',USER='mfranka',CD='Mar  4 08:39 2011' -->

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#TableOfContents" title="Click to go to Table of Contents">Table of Contents</a></font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We continue to believe that mobile digital broadcast television (mobile DTV) represents a tremendous and efficient use of our digital spectrum and could provide a significant revenue stream to the television broadcasting industry.&#160; Mobile DTV enables consumers to watch live television on their laptops, smart phones, tablet computers and other mobile devices, as well as out-of-home platforms such as billboards and vehicles, all using a broadcast signal and without using the bandwidth of wireless providers.&#160; We expect over&#151;the-air television delivered to mobile and out-of-home devices in local markets to meet the growing demand of on-the-go consumers, and to expand upon the one-to-many efficiencies provided by local broadcasters.&#160; We are a member of the Open Mobile Video Coalition (the OMVC), which is an alliance of U.S. commercial and public broadcasters formed to accelerate the development and rollout of mobile DTV products and services. The OMVC is committed to creating the technical and commercial environment which would allow broadcasters to maximize and develop the full business potential of the digital television spectrum.&#160; The OMVC working within the Advanced Television Systems Committee (ATSC), has developed a mobile broadcasting system that will allow users with mobile and portable devices to receive our digital signals and watch live television.&#160; Broadcasters are working with the OMVC to understand and develop an innovative and viable business.&#160; The OMVC launched a consumer showcase in the Washington, D.C. area during the second quarter of 2010 in an effort to demonstrate and accelerate an understanding of the mobile DTV business opportunity.&#160; The showcase provided participants with mobile devices that received 23 channels of programming, including one of our station&#146;s channels, in the Washington D.C. area.&#160; The feedback from the showcase revealed that &#147;convenience is a key. With viewers checking in wherever they go,&#148; including while commuting on public transportation, during work lunch breaks, while running errands and at home when someone else is watching the main television.&#160; Most of showcase participants favored live local programming like newscasts and daytime programming.&#160; We expect mobile DTV to increase our viewership; however, we are uncertain when this will occur.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The advent of the OMVC has resulted in the creation of two organizations, the Mobile 500 Alliance (the M500) and the Mobile Content Venture (the MCV), that pursue mobile DTV business development.&#160; The M500 is comprised of more than 40 broadcast groups which collectively represent approximately 400 stations reaching about 92% share of the television households.&#160; The M500 brings together leading broadcasters in a collective, focused effort to accelerate the nationwide availability of mobile DTV service.&#160; The M500 is exploring programming, distribution and aggregation opportunities that bring value to local broadcasting.&#160; We are a member of the M500.&#160; The MCV is comprised of 12 broadcast groups whose aim is to develop a new national mobile content service by utilizing existing broadcast spectrum to enable the delivery of content including live and on-demand video, local and national news from print and electronic sources, as well as sports and entertainment programming to mobile devices.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We continue to strategize on various potential uses of our digital spectrum.&#160; Besides high-definition programming and mobile DTV, we use our digital spectrum through other multi-channel digital initiatives such as second and third channel broadcasting of This TV, independent programming; TheCoolTV and The Country Network,&#160; music video providers; Estrella TV, a Spanish-language television network; and MyNetworkTV.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We are a Maryland corporation formed in 1986.&#160; Our principal offices are located at 10706 Beaver Dam Road, Hunt Valley, Maryland 21030.&#160; Our telephone number is (410) 568-1500 and our website address is www.sbgi.net.</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5<a name="PB_5_145735_2897"></a></font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='5',FILE='C:\JMS\mfranka\11-2081-1\task4533662\2081-1-ba-03.htm',USER='mfranka',CD='Mar  4 08:39 2011' -->

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Markets and Stations</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We own and operate, provide programming services to, provide sales services to or have agreed to acquire the following television stations:</font></p>

<td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.76%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>
<td width="11%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.84%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12/01/13</font></p>    </td>   </tr>  </table>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Rankings are based on the relative size of a station&#146;s designated market area (DMA) among the 210 generally recognized DMAs in the United States as estimated by Nielsen as of November&nbsp;2010.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;O&nbsp;&amp; O&#148; refers to stations that we own and operate.&#160; &#147;LMA&#148; refers to stations to which we provide programming services pursuant to a local marketing agreement.&#160; &#147;OSA&#148; refers to stations to which we provide or receive sales services pursuant to an outsourcing agreement.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">When we negotiate the terms of our network affiliations or program service arrangements, we negotiate on behalf of all of our stations affiliated with that entity simultaneously.&#160; This results in substantially similar terms for our stations, including the expiration date of the network affiliations or program service arrangements.&#160; A summary of these expiration dates for our primary channels as of December&nbsp;31, 2010 is as follows:</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="80%" style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:.75in;width:80.0%;">

<td width="28%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:28.16%;">

<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="69%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:69.86%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Expiration&nbsp;Date</font></b></p>    </td>   </tr>

<td width="28%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:28.16%;">

<td width="69%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:69.86%;">

<td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>

<td width="28%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:28.16%;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(d)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The first number represents the rank of each station in its market and is based upon the November&nbsp;2010 Nielsen estimates of the percentage of persons tuned into each station in the market from 6:00&nbsp;a.m. to 2:00&nbsp;a.m., Monday through Sunday.&#160; The second number represents the estimated number of television stations designated by Nielsen as &#147;local&#148; to the DMA, excluding public television stations and stations that do not meet the minimum Nielsen reporting standards (weekly cumulative audience of at least 0.1%) for the Monday through Sunday 6:00&nbsp;a.m. to 2:00&nbsp;a.m. time period as of November&nbsp;2010.&#160; This information is provided to us in a summary report by Franco Research Group Inc.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(e)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The license assets for this station are currently owned by Bay Television,&nbsp;Inc., a related party.&#160; See <i>Note 11.</i>  <i>Related Person Transactions</i>, in the Notes to our Consolidated Financial Statements for more information.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(f)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We, or subsidiaries of Cunningham Broadcasting Company (Cunningham), timely filed applications for renewal of these licenses with the FCC.&#160; Unrelated third parties have filed petitions to deny or informal objections against such applications.&#160; We opposed the petitions to deny and the informal objections and those applications are pending.&#160; See <i>Note 10.</i>  <i>Commitments and Contingencies</i>, in the Notes to our Consolidated Financial Statements for more information.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(g)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The license assets for these stations are currently owned by a subsidiary of Cunningham.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(h)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have entered into an outsourcing agreement with the unrelated third party owner of WNAB-TV to provide certain non-programming related sales, operational and administrative services to WNAB-TV. On July&nbsp;21, 2005, we filed with the FCC an application to acquire the license television broadcast assets of WNAB-TV in Nashville, Tennessee.&nbsp;&nbsp; The Rainbow/PUSH Coalition (&#147;Rainbow/PUSH&#148;) filed a petition to deny that application and also requested that the FCC initiate a hearing to investigate whether WNAB-TV was improperly operated with WZTV-TV and WUXP-TV, two of our stations also located in Nashville.&nbsp; The FCC is in the process of considering the transfer of the broadcast license and we believe the Rainbow/PUSH petition has no merit.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(i)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">WDBB-TV simulcasts the programming broadcast on WTTO-TV pursuant to a programming services agreement.&#160; The station rank applies to the combined viewership of these stations.&#160; In fourth quarter 2010, the FCC approved Cunningham&#146;s acquisition of WDBB&#146;s license assets.&#160; In February&nbsp;2011, Cunningham acquired the license assets and we will continue to operate WDBB pursuant to a LMA agreement.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(j)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have entered into outsourcing agreements with unrelated third parties, under which the unrelated third parties provide certain non-programming related sales, operational and managerial services to these stations.&#160; We continue to own all of the assets of these stations and to program and control each station&#146;s operations.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(k)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">WICD-TV, a satellite of WICS-TV under FCC rules, simulcasts all of the programming aired on WICS-TV except the news broadcasts.&#160; WICD-TV airs its own news broadcasts.&#160; The station rank applies to the combined viewership of these stations.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">8<a name="PB_8_154117_5796"></a></font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='8',FILE='C:\JMS\mfranka\11-2081-1\task4533662\2081-1-ba-03.htm',USER='mfranka',CD='Mar  4 08:39 2011' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#TableOfContents" title="Click to go to Table of Contents">Table of Contents</a></font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(l)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On February&nbsp;1, 2008, we entered into an outsourcing agreement with the unrelated third party owner of KFXA-TV to provide certain non-programming related sales, operational and administrative services to KFXA-TV. During 2008, we entered into an agreement with an unrelated third party for the right to acquire the FCC license of KFXA-TV in Cedar Rapids,&nbsp;Iowa, pending FCC approval.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(m)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We timely filed applications for renewal of these licenses with the FCC. Unrelated third parties have filed informal objections against the stations based on alleged violations of either the FCC&#146;s sponsorship identification or indecency rules.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Operating Strategy</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our operating strategy includes the following elements:</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Programming to Attract Viewership</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; We seek to target our programming offerings to attract viewership, to meet the needs of the communities in which we serve and to meet the needs of our advertising customers.&#160; In pursuit of this strategy, we seek to obtain, at attractive prices, popular syndicated programming that is complementary to each station&#146;s network programming.&#160; We also seek to broadcast live local and national sporting events that would appeal to a large segment of the local community.&#160; Moreover, we produce news at 18 stations in 12 markets, including three stations which have a local news sharing agreement with a competitive station in that market.&#160; We have 13 stations which have local news sharing arrangements with a competitive station in that market, which produces the news aired on our station.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Television<i>  </i>advertising prices are primarily based on ratings information measured and distributed by The Nielsen Company (Nielsen).&#160; In 2010, the Media Rating Council, an independent organization set-up to monitor rating services, revoked Nielsen&#146;s accreditation in the 154 markets it measures ratings exclusively by its diary methodology.&#160; Approximately 14 of our stations are currently diary only markets.&#160; In January&nbsp;2011, for certain markets, including our diary only markets, we entered into a contract with Rentrak Corporation, an alternative rating service provider, that uses set-top box television measurements to provide us additional measurement information to the ratings services Nielsen provides.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Attract and Retain High Quality Management</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; We believe that much of our success is due to our ability to attract and retain highly skilled and motivated managers at both the corporate and local station levels.&#160; We provide a combination of base salary, long-term incentive compensation including equity awards and, where appropriate, cash bonus pay designed to be competitive with comparable employers in the television broadcast industry.&#160; A significant portion of the compensation available to certain members of our senior management and our sales force is based on their achievement of certain performance goals.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Developing Local Franchises</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; We believe the greatest opportunity for a sustainable and growing customer base lies within our local communities.&#160; Therefore, we have focused on developing a strong local sales force at each of our television stations, which is comprised of approximately 320 sales account executives company-wide.&#160; Excluding political advertising revenue, 69.3% of our net time sales were local for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010, compared to 69.4% in 2009.&#160; Excluding political, local revenues have increased 8.7% during 2010 versus 2009. Market share survey results reflect that our stations&#146; share of the local television advertising market, held stable at approximately 19% in 2010 and 2009.&#160; Our goal is to grow our local revenues by increasing our market share and by developing new business opportunities.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Local News</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; We believe that the production and broadcasting of local news is an important link to the community and an aid to a station&#146;s efforts to expand its viewership.&#160; In addition, local news programming can provide access to advertising sources targeted specifically to local news viewers.&#160; We assess the anticipated benefits and costs of producing local news prior to the introduction of local news at our stations because a significant investment in capital equipment is required and substantial operating expenses are incurred in introducing, developing and producing local news programming.&#160; We also continuously review the performance of our existing news operations to make sure they are economically viable.&#160; We have upgraded several of our markets to provide high&#151;definition (HD) news programming.&#160; We expect to roll out HD news programming to our remaining news producing markets in the next several years.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our local news initiatives are an important part of our strategy that has resulted in our entering into 13 local news sharing arrangements with other television broadcasters.&#160; We are the provider of news services in three instances while in 10 of our news share arrangements, we are the recipient of services.&#160; We believe news share arrangements generally provide both higher viewer ratings and revenues for the station receiving the news and generate a profit for the news share provider.&#160; Generally, both parties and the local community are beneficiaries of these arrangements.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Developing New Business</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; We are always striving to develop new business models to complement or enhance our existing television broadcast business.&#160; We have developed new ways to bundle online, mobile text messaging and coupon advertising with our traditional commercial broadcasting model.&#160; We plan to continue to expand our efforts in this area.&#160; In addition, we are making progress on standardizing and implementing a viable business platform for mobile DTV.&#160; We continue to explore new opportunities and plan to implement new initiatives in 2011.</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">9<a name="PB_9_154323_2897"></a></font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='9',FILE='C:\JMS\105933\11-2081-1\task4529165\2081-1-ba-05.htm',USER='105933',CD='Mar  2 20:41 2011' -->

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#TableOfContents" title="Click to go to Table of Contents">Table of Contents</a></font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Retransmission Consent Agreements</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; We have retransmission consent agreements with MVPDs, such as cable, satellite and telecommunications operators in our markets.&#160; MVPDs compensate us for the right to retransmit our broadcast signals.&#160; Our successful negotiations with MVPDs have created agreements that now produce meaningful sustainable revenue streams.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Ownership Duopolies and Utilization of Local Marketing Agreements</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; We have sought to increase our revenues and improve our margins through the ownership of two stations in a single market, called a duopoly, and by providing programming services pursuant to a LMA to a second station in eight DMAs where we already own one station.&#160; Duopolies and LMAs allow us to realize significant economies of scale in marketing, programming, overhead and capital expenditures.&#160; We also believe these arrangements enable us to air popular programming and contribute to the diversity of programming within each DMA.&#160; Although under the FCC ownership rules&nbsp;released in June&nbsp;2003 (the 2003 Rules), we would be allowed to continue to program most of the stations with which we have a LMA, in the absence of a waiver, the 2003 Rules&nbsp;would require us to terminate or modify three of our LMAs.&#160; Although there can be no assurances, we have studied the application of the 2003 Rules&nbsp;to our markets and believe we are qualified for waivers.&#160; Under the ownership rules&nbsp;established in 2008, we may be required to terminate or modify three more of our LMAs that we executed after November&nbsp;5, 1996.&#160; We also may be required to terminate or modify three other LMAs that we executed prior to November&nbsp;5, 1996, if the FCC subsequently initiates a case-by-case review of those LMAs and determines not to extend the grandfathering period.&#160; For additional information, refer to <i>Risk Factors - Changes in Rules&nbsp;on Television Ownership</i>, and <i>Risk Factors - The FCC&#146;s multiple ownership rules&nbsp;limit our ability to operate multiple television stations in some markets and may result in a reduction in our revenue or prevent us from reducing costs.&#160; Changes in these rules&nbsp;may threaten our existing strategic approach to certain television markets</i>.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Use of Outsourcing Agreements/Joint Sales Agreements (JSAs)</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; In addition to our LMAs, we operate under four (and may seek opportunities for additional) outsourcing agreements in which our stations provide or are provided various non-programming related services such as sales, operational and managerial services to or by other stations.&#160; Pursuant to these agreements, our stations in Nashville, Tennessee and Cedar Rapids,&nbsp;Iowa provide services to another station in each&#146;s respective market and another party provides services to our stations in Peoria/Bloomington,&nbsp;Illinois and Rochester, New York.&#160; We believe the outsourcing structure allows stations to achieve operational efficiencies and economies of scale, which should improve broadcast cash flow and competitive positions.&#160; While television JSAs are not currently &#147;attributable&#148;, as that term is defined by the FCC, on August&nbsp;2, 2004, the FCC released a notice of proposed rulemaking seeking comments on its tentative conclusion that television joint sales agreements should be attributable.&#160; We cannot predict the outcome of this proceeding, nor can we predict how many changes, together with possible changes to ownership rules, would apply to our existing outsourcing agreements.&#160; See the <i>Local Marketing Agreements</i> under the <i>Federal Regulation of Television Broadcasting</i> section below.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Multi-Channel Digital Broadcasting.&#160; </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">FCC rules&nbsp;allow broadcasters to transmit additional digital channels within the spectrum allocated to each FCC license holder.&#160; This provides viewers with additional programming alternatives at no additional cost to them.&#160; W</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">e are airing second and third digital channels comprised of This TV, independent programming; TheCoolTV and The Country Network, music video providers; Estrella TV, a Spanish-language television network and MyNetworkTV.&#160; In addition, as noted below, we believe mobile DTV will serve as an additional use of our digital spectrum. We may consider other alternative programming formats that we could air using our multi-channel digital spectrum space with the goal towards achieving higher profits and community service.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mobile Digital Broadcast Television (mobile DTV).&nbsp; </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We are a founding member of the OMVC.&#160; The OMVC&#160; is an alliance of U.S. commercial and public broadcasters formed to accelerate the development and rollout of mobile DTV products and services. The OMVC is committed to maximizing and developing the full potential of the digital television spectrum.&nbsp; We believe mobile DTV will quickly provide for a viable use of our local stations&#146; programming.&nbsp; &nbsp;The OMVC, working within the ATSC, has developed a mobile broadcasting standard that allows digital television to be broadcast to numerous mobile devices including smart phones, laptop and tablet computers, video screens in vehicles, portable video players and other mobile and portable devices.&nbsp; In order to receive mobile DTV signals, these devices require a mobile DTV receiver.&nbsp; We believe that the technical ability to receive our television broadcast content on mobile devices will be attractive to individuals.&nbsp; The OMVC launched a consumer showcase in the Washington, D.C. area the second quarter of 2010 in an effort to demonstrate and accelerate the advancement of mobile DTV.&nbsp; We believe this technology, if successfully implemented, could create an entirely new revenue stream for television broadcasters.&nbsp; With the technology and business strategy in process, the industry has made mobile DTV services &#147;on-the-air&#148; in 28 markets reaching more than 35.0% of U.S. Households.&nbsp; According to the OMVC, the industry expectation is that upwards of 150 stations will be &#147;on-the-air&#148; at the end of 2011.&#160; We expect to participate in the initial launch of this service by broadcasting mobile DTV beginning with 5 of our stations in key markets.&#160; We will gauge our plans on the successes of these first markets, and deploy within remaining markets accordingly.</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10<a name="PB_10_154344_3020"></a></font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='10',FILE='C:\JMS\105933\11-2081-1\task4529165\2081-1-ba-05.htm',USER='105933',CD='Mar  2 20:41 2011' -->

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#TableOfContents" title="Click to go to Table of Contents">Table of Contents</a></font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Control of Operating and Programming Costs</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; By employing a disciplined approach to managing programming acquisition and other costs, we have been able to achieve operating margins that we believe are very competitive within the television broadcast industry.&#160; We believe our national reach of approximately 22% of the country provides us with a strong position to negotiate with programming providers and, as a result, the opportunity to purchase high quality programming at more favorable prices.&#160; Moreover, we emphasize control of each of our station&#146;s programming and operating costs through program-specific profit analysis, detailed budgeting, regionalization of staff and detailed long-term planning models.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Popular Sporting Events</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; At some of our stations, we have been able to acquire local television broadcast rights for certain sporting events, including NBA basketball, Major League Baseball, NFL football, NHL hockey, ACC basketball and both Big Ten and SEC football and basketball and high school sports.&#160; We seek to expand our sports broadcasting in DMAs as profitable opportunities arise.&#160; Our CW and MyNetworkTV stations generally face fewer preemption restrictions on broadcasting live local sporting events compared with our FOX, ABC, CBS and NBC stations, which are required to broadcast a greater number of hours of programming supplied by the networks.&#160; In addition, our stations that are affiliated with FOX, ABC, CBS and NBC have network arrangements to broadcast certain NBA basketball games, Major League Baseball games, NFL football games, NHL hockey games and NASCAR races, as well as other popular sporting events.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Strategic Realignment of Station Portfolio</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; We continue to examine our television station group portfolio in light of the 2003 Rules.&#160; For a summary of these rules, refer to <i>Ownership Matters,</i> discussed in the <i>Federal Regulation of Television Broadcasting</i>.&#160; Our objective has been to build our local franchises in the markets we deem strategic.&#160; We routinely review and conduct investigations of potential television station acquisitions, dispositions and station swaps.&#160; At any given time, we may be in discussions with one or more television station owners.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Non-broadcast Investments.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; We have sought ways to diversify our business and return additional value to our shareholders through investments in non-broadcast based businesses and real estate.&#160; We carry investments in various companies from different industries including sign design and fabrication and security alarm monitoring and bulk acquisition.&#160; In addition, we invest in various real estate ventures including developmental land and apartment and shopping complexes.&#160; We also invest in private equity and structure debt and mezzanine financing investment funds.&#160; Currently, operating results from our investments represent a small portion of our overall operating results; and our ability to make additional investments is limited by the restrictions of our Bank Credit Agreement.&#160; Activity related to our investments is included in our other operating divisions segment.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FEDERAL REGULATION OF TELEVISION BROADCASTING</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The ownership, operation and sale of television stations are subject to the jurisdiction of the FCC, which acts under the authority granted by the Communications Act of 1934, as amended (the Communications Act).&#160; Among other things, the FCC assigns frequency bands for broadcasting; determines the particular frequencies, locations and operating power of stations; issues, renews, revokes and modifies station licenses; regulates equipment used by stations; adopts and implements regulations and policies that directly or indirectly affect the ownership, operation and employment practices of stations; and has the power to impose penalties for violations of its rules&nbsp;or the Communications Act.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following is a brief summary of certain provisions of the Communications Act, the Telecommunications Act of 1996 (the 1996 Act) and specific FCC regulations and policies.&#160; Reference should be made to the Communications Act, the 1996 Act, FCC rules&nbsp;and the public notices and rulings of the FCC for further information concerning the nature and extent of federal regulation of broadcast stations.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">License Grant and Renewal</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Television stations operate pursuant to broadcasting licenses that are granted by the FCC for maximum terms of eight years and are subject to renewal upon application to the FCC.&#160; During certain periods when renewal applications are pending, petitions to deny license renewals can be filed by interested parties, including members of the public.&#160; The FCC will generally grant a renewal application if it finds:</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">that the station has served the public interest, convenience and necessity;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">that there have been no serious violations by the licensee of the Communications Act or the rules&nbsp;and regulations of the FCC; and</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">that there have been no other violations by the licensee of the Communications Act or the rules&nbsp;and regulations of the FCC that, when taken together, would constitute a pattern of misconduct.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">All of the stations that we currently own and operate or provide programming services or sales services to, pursuant to LMAs or other agreements, are presently operating under regular licenses, which expire as to each station on the dates set forth under </font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">11<a name="PB_11_154422_7748"></a></font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='11',FILE='C:\JMS\105933\11-2081-1\task4529165\2081-1-ba-05.htm',USER='105933',CD='Mar  2 20:41 2011' -->

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#TableOfContents" title="Click to go to Table of Contents">Table of Contents</a></font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">&nbsp;</font></i></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Television Broadcasting</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> above.&#160; Although renewal of a license is granted in the vast majority of cases even when petitions to deny are filed, there can be no assurance that the license of any station will be renewed.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2004, we filed with the FCC an application for the license renewal of WBFF-TV in Baltimore, Maryland.&#160; Subsequently, an individual named Richard D&#146;Amato filed a petition to deny the application.&#160; In 2004, we also filed with the FCC applications for the license renewal of television stations: WXLV-TV, Winston-Salem, North Carolina; WMYV-TV, Greensboro, North Carolina; WLFL-TV, Raleigh/Durham, North Carolina; WRDC-TV, Raleigh/Durham, North Carolina; WLOS-TV, Asheville, North Carolina and WMMP-TV, Charleston, South Carolina.&#160; An organization calling itself &#147;Free Press&#148; filed a petition to deny the renewal applications of these stations and also the renewal applications of two other stations in those markets, which we program pursuant to LMAs: WTAT-TV, Charleston, South Carolina and WMYA-TV, Anderson, South Carolina.&#160; Several individuals and an organization named &#147;Sinclair Media Watch&#148; also filed informal objections to the license renewal applications of WLOS-TV and WMYA-TV, raising essentially the same arguments presented in the Free Press petition.&#160; The FCC is in the process of considering these renewal applications and we believe the objections have no merit.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On July&nbsp;21, 2005, we filed with the FCC an application to acquire the license television broadcast assets of WNAB-TV in Nashville, Tennessee.&#160;&#160; The Rainbow/PUSH Coalition (Rainbow/PUSH) filed a petition to deny that application and also requested that the FCC initiate a hearing to investigate whether WNAB-TV was improperly operated with WZTV-TV and WUXP-TV, two of our stations located in the same market as WNAB-TV.&#160; The FCC is in the process of considering the transfer of the broadcast license and we believe the Rainbow/PUSH petition has no merit.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On August&nbsp;1, 2005, we filed applications with the FCC requesting renewal of the broadcast licenses for WICS-TV and WICD-TV in Springfield/Champaign,&nbsp;Illinois.&#160; Subsequently, various viewers filed informal objections requesting that the FCC deny these renewal applications.&#160; On September&nbsp;30, 2005, we filed an application with the FCC for the renewal of the broadcast license for KGAN-TV in Cedar Rapids,&nbsp;Iowa.&#160; On December&nbsp;28, 2005, an organization calling itself &#147;Iowans for Better Local Television&#148; filed a petition to deny that application.&#160; In April&nbsp;2009, the FCC granted the license renewal application for WICD-TV and KGAN-TV.&#160; The FCC is in the process of considering the WICS-TV renewal applications and we believe the objections and petitions requesting denial have no merit.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
