<td width="15%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:15.06%;">
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.07</font></p>    </td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.36%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>   </tr>
<tr>
<td width="59%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:59.12%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Fourth Quarter</font></p>    </td>
<td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.4%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>    </td>
<td width="15%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:15.06%;">
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5.03</font></p>    </td>
<td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.4%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>    </td>
<td width="15%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:15.06%;">
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.95</font></p>    </td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.36%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>   </tr>  </table>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of February&nbsp;28, 2011, there were approximately 82 shareholders of record of our common stock.&#160; This number does not include beneficial owners holding shares through nominee names.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Dividend Policy</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In February&nbsp;2009, we decided it was prudent to suspend the dividend due to the negative economic climate.&#160; Amid improvements in general economic conditions and in our performance, in November&nbsp;2010, our Board of Directors declared a $0.43 per share common stock dividend payable on December&nbsp;15, 2010 to holders of record on December&nbsp;1, 2010.&#160; In February&nbsp;2011, our Board of Directors reinstated our dividend policy, declaring a quarterly common stock dividend of $0.12 per share.&#160; Future dividends on our common shares, if any, will be at the discretion of our Board of Directors and will depend on several factors including our results of operations, cash requirements and surplus, financial condition, covenant restrictions and other factors that the Board of Directors may deem relevant.&#160; The Class&nbsp;A Common Stock and Class&nbsp;B Common Stock holders have the same rights related to dividends.&#160; Our Bank Credit Agreement and some of our debt instruments contain restrictions on our ability to pay dividends.&#160; Under our Bank Credit Agreement, in certain circumstances we may make up to $40.0 million in unrestricted annual cash payments including but not limited to dividends.&#160; Under the indentures governing our 9.25% Second Lien Notes, due 2017 (the 9.25% Notes) and our 8.375% Senior Notes, due 2018 (the 8.375% Notes), we are restricted from paying dividends on our common stock unless certain specified conditions are satisfied, including that:</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">no event of default then exists under each indenture or certain other specified agreements relating to our indebtedness; and</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">after taking account of the dividends payment, we are within certain restricted payment requirements contained in each indenture.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, under certain of our debt instruments, the payment of dividends is not permissible during a default thereunder.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:6.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Issuer Purchases of Equity Securities</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the fourth quarter 2010, we repurchased, pursuant to a tender offer, $58.0 million in principal amount of the 6.0% Convertible Subordinated Debentures, due 2012 (the 6.0% Notes).</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 6.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; SELECTED FINANCIAL DATA</font></b><a name="Item6_SelectedFinancialData_145707"></a></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The selected consolidated financial data for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2010, 2009 and 2008 have been derived from our audited consolidated financial statements.&#160; The consolidated financial statements for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2010, 2009 and 2008 are included elsewhere in this report.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The information below should be read in conjunction with <i>Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations</i> and the consolidated financial statements included elsewhere in this report.</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">34<a name="PB_34_145715_1065"></a></font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">627,075</font></p>    </td>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>   </tr>
<tr>
<td width="36%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:36.5%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Revenues realized   from station barter arrangements</font></p>    </td>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net broadcast revenues is defined as broadcast revenues, net of agency commissions.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Depreciation and amortization includes amortization of program contract costs and net realizable value adjustments, depreciation and amortization of property and equipment and amortization of definite-lived intangible assets and other assets.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total debt is defined as notes payable, capital leases and commercial bank financing, including the current and long-term portions.</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">35<a name="PB_35_150011_9995"></a></font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='35',FILE='C:\JMS\C900708\11-2081-1\task4532518\2081-1-ba-09.htm',USER='c900708',CD='Mar  4 07:09 2011' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#TableOfContents" title="Click to go to Table of Contents">Table of Contents</a></font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 62.65pt;text-indent:-62.65pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 7.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">MANAGEMENT&#146;S DIS<a name="Item7_ManagementsDis_230744"></a>CUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 63.0pt;text-indent:-63.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis provides qualitative and quantitative information about our financial performance and condition and should be read in conjunction with our consolidated financial statements and the accompanying notes to those statements.&#160; This discussion consists of the following sections:</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Executive Overview</font></u></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> &#151; a description of our business, financial highlights from 2010, information about industry trends and sources of revenues and operating costs;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Critical Accounting Policies and Estimates</font></u></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> &#151; a discussion of the accounting policies that are most important in understanding the assumptions and judgments incorporated in the consolidated financial statements and a summary of recent accounting pronouncements;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Results of Operations</font></u></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> &#151; a summary of the components of our revenues by category and by network affiliation or program service arrangement, a summary of other operating data and an analysis of our revenues and expenses for 2010, 2009 and 2008, including comparisons between years and certain expectations for 2011; and</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Liquidity and Capital Resources</font></u></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> &#151; a discussion of our primary sources of liquidity, an analysis of our cash flows from or used in operating activities, investing activities and financing activities, a discussion of our dividend policy and a summary of our contractual cash obligations and off-balance sheet arrangements.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have two reportable operating segments, &#147;broadcast&#148; and &#147;other operating divisions&#148; that are disclosed separately from our corporate activities.&#160; Our broadcast segment includes our stations.&#160; Our other operating divisions segment primarily earned revenues in 2010 from sign design and fabrication; regional security alarm operating and bulk acquisitions; and real estate ventures.&#160; In addition to the revenues noted in 2010, in 2009, our other operating divisions segment earned revenues from information technology staffing, consulting and software development; and transmitter manufacturing.&#160; Corporate and unallocated expenses primarily include our costs to operate as a public company and to operate our corporate headquarters location.&#160; Corporate is not a reportable segment.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">STG, included in the broadcast segment and a wholly owned subsidiary of Sinclair Broadcast Group,&nbsp;Inc. (SBG), is the primary obligor under our Bank Credit Agreement, the 9.25% Notes and the 8.375% Notes and was the primary obligor under the 8.0% Senior Subordinated Notes, due 2012 (the 8.0% Notes ) until they were fully redeemed in 2010.&#160; Our Class&nbsp;A Common Stock, Class&nbsp;B Common Stock, the 6.0% Notes, the 4.875% Convertible Senior Notes due 2018 (the 4.875% Notes) and the 3.0% Convertible Senior Notes due 2027 (the 3.0% Notes) remain obligations and securities of SBG and are not obligations or securities of STG.&#160; SBG is a guarantor under the Bank Credit Agreement, the 9.25% Notes and the 8.375% Notes.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">EXECUTIVE OVERVIEW</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">2010 Events</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In January, we entered into a one-year retransmission consent agreement with Mediacom for continued carriage of the signals of 22 stations owned and/or operated by us in 15 markets;&#160; In December, we entered into a further renewal of our retransmission consent agreement with Mediacom for a term expiring January&nbsp;1, 2013;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In February, we entered into an agreement for carriage of TheCoolTV, a music video provider on certain of our stations&#146; secondary digital signal;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In February, we entered into a network affiliation agreement effective September&nbsp;1, 2010 with The CW for KMYS-TV in San Antonio, Texas, expiring August&nbsp;31, 2011.&#160; KMYS-TV switched from MyNetworkTV to The CW on the effective date;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In February, we purchased at par approximately $12.3 million and $14.3 million of the 3.0% and 4.875% Notes, respectively, pursuant to tender offers;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In March, we entered into a renewal of nine ABC network affiliation agreements which represents all of our ABC affiliates, effective January&nbsp;1, 2010 and expiring August&nbsp;31, 2015;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In April, we prepaid $25.0 million of the Bank Credit Agreement&#146;s Term Loan B;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">36<a name="PB_36_144052_5335"></a></font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='36',FILE='C:\JMS\rcheney\11-2081-1\task4533833\2081-1-ba-11.htm',USER='rcheney',CD='Mar  4 10:34 2011' -->

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#TableOfContents" title="Click to go to Table of Contents">Table of Contents</a></font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In May, the put right period for the 3.0% Notes expired and holders representing $10.0 million of the notes exercised their put rights.&#160; Holders of the remaining $5.4 million of 3.0% Notes can exercise put rights again in May&nbsp;2017;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In August, we entered into an agreement with The Country Network, a country music video network, to air on 34 of our stations&#146; second or third digital signal;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In August, we entered into an amendment of our Bank Credit Agreement.&#160; Under the amendment we paid down $35.0 million of the outstanding $305.0 million balance of our Term Loan B and repriced the remaining outstanding amount of $270.0 million;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September, we repurchased, in the open market, $17.0 million of the 4.875% Notes;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In October, we issued $250.0 million of 8.375% Notes;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In October, we received $8.4 million in federal tax refunds;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In October, we purchased approximately $58.0 million and $175.7 million of 6.0% and 8.0% Notes, respectively, pursuant to tender offers;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In November, our Board of Directors declared a $0.43 per share common stock dividend paid in December&nbsp;2010;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In November, we redeemed all of the remaining $49.0 million of 8.0% Notes;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In December, we renewed our FOX affiliation agreements, which were due to expire on March 2012, until December&nbsp;31, 2012. We also entered into a programming licensing agreement with the FOX network which allows the Company to enter into retransmission consent agreements with distributors for the remainder of the affiliation agreement;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Excluding political, local revenues have increased 13.0% and national revenues have increased 8.9% during 2010 versus 2009 as advertising levels and retransmission revenues have gained momentum.&#160; Production, selling and general and administrative expenses combined have increased 6.0% over the same period primarily due to higher revenues and commissions; and</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Political revenues increased 2.2% compared to 2008 and 34.9% compared to 2006.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">2011 Events</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In January, the put right period for the 4.875% Notes expired and no holders of the remaining $5.7 million outstanding exercised put rights.&#160; There are no further put rights through final maturity on July&nbsp;15, 2018;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In January, we extended our program service arrangement with MyNetworkTV until Fall 2014;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In January, we entered into a multi-year retransmission consent agreement with Bright House Networks, LLC for the carriage of six of the stations owned and/or operated by us in four markets;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In February, our Board of Directors reinstated a quarterly common stock dividend of $0.12 per share;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In February, we entered into a multi-year retransmission consent agreement with Time Warner Cable for continued carriage of 28 of the stations owned and /or operated by us in 17 markets;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In February, revenue related to the Super Bowl, which aired on our 20 FOX affiliates was $6.2 million, a 26.5% increase from revenue generated in 2008, the last time FOX aired the Super Bowl; and</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In February, we disclosed our intention to refinance a portion of and to amend certain terms of the Bank Credit Agreement.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In March, we reached an agreement-in-principle with Comcast Corporation for a multi-year retransmission consent agreement for the continued carriage of 36 stations in 22 markets owned and/or operated by us or to which we provide sales services.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Industry Trends</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Political advertising increases in even-numbered years, such as 2010, due to the advertising expenditures from candidates running in local and national elections.&#160; In addition, political revenue has consistently risen between presidential election or mid-term election years such as from 2004 to 2008 or from 2006 to 2010, respectively.&#160; In every fourth year, such as 2008, political advertising is usually elevated further due to presidential elections.&#160; However, due to the contentious mid-term elections our political revenues in 2010 not only exceeded 2006 results, but exceeded 2008 presidential election year revenues as well;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The FCC has permitted broadcast television stations to use their digital spectrum for a wide variety of services including multi-channel broadcasts.&#160; The FCC &#147;must carry&#148; rules&nbsp;only apply to a station&#146;s primary digital stream;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A number of other broadcasters, including Sinclair, have joined together in organizations such as the OMVC, M500 and the MCV to focus on efforts to accelerate the nationwide availability of mobile DTV service and work through programming, distribution and aggregation opportunities.&#160; There is potential for broadcasters to create an additional revenue stream by providing their signals to mobile devices as well as through other multi-channel initiatives;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Retransmission consent rules&nbsp;provide a mechanism for broadcasters to seek payment from multi-channel video programming distributors (MVPDs) who carry broadcasters&#146; signals.&#160; Recognition of the value of the programming content provided by broadcasters, including local news and other programming and network programming all in HD has generated increased local revenues;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">37<a name="PB_37_144139_5796"></a></font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='37',FILE='C:\JMS\rcheney\11-2081-1\task4533833\2081-1-ba-11.htm',USER='rcheney',CD='Mar  4 10:34 2011' -->

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#TableOfContents" title="Click to go to Table of Contents">Table of Contents</a></font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Automotive-related advertising is a significant portion of our total net revenues in all periods presented and these revenues trended downward in most of 2009 due to the economic turmoil.&#160; However, this sector has dramatically trended upward in 2010 and into 2011 as of the date of this filing, due to improved economic conditions;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Many broadcasters are enhancing/upgrading their websites to use the internet to deliver rich media content, such as newscasts and weather updates, to attract advertisers;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Seasonal advertising increases in the second and fourth quarters due to the anticipation of certain seasonal and holiday spending by consumers;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Broadcasters have found ways to increase returns on their news programming initiatives while continuing to maintain locally produced content through the use of news sharing arrangements;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Station outsourcing arrangements are becoming more common as broadcasters seek out ways to improve revenues and margins;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Advertising revenue related to the Olympics occurs in even numbered years and the Super Bowl is aired on a different network each year.&#160; Both of these popularly viewed events can have an impact on our advertising revenues; and</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Compensation from networks to their affiliates in exchange for broadcasting of network programming has halted.&#160; Networks now require compensation from broadcasters for the use of network programming.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Sources of Revenues and Costs</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our operating revenues are derived from local and national advertisers and, to a much lesser extent, from political advertisers.&#160; From 2006 to 2010, we began to generate new local revenues from our retransmission consent agreements.&#160; Our revenues from local advertisers had seen a continued upward trend until 2008 and 2009 when non-political revenues fell from 2007 due to the economic recession.&#160; We saw an increase in local revenues in 2010.&#160; Revenues from national advertisers have continued to trend downward when measured as a percentage of total broadcast revenues.&#160; We believe this trend is the result of our focus on increasing local advertising revenues as a percentage of total advertising revenues, combined with a decrease in overall spending by national advertisers and an increase in the number of competitive media outlets providing national advertisers multiple alternatives in which to advertise their goods or services.&#160; Our efforts to mitigate the effect of these increasingly competitive media outlets for national advertisers include continuing our efforts to increase local revenues and developing innovative sales and marketing strategies to sell traditional and non-traditional services to our advertisers including the success of multi-channel digital initiatives together with mobile DTV.&#160; In addition, our revenue success is dependent on the success and advertising spending levels of the automotive industry.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">CRITICAL ACCOUNTING POLICIES AND ESTIMATES</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">This discussion and analysis of our financial condition and results of operations is based on our consolidated financial statements which have been prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States.&#160; The preparation of these financial statements requires us to make estimates and judgments that affect the reported amount of assets, liabilities, revenues and expenses and related disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities.&#160; On an on-going basis, we evaluate our estimates including those related to bad debts, program contract costs, intangible assets, income taxes, property and equipment, investments and derivative contracts.&#160; We base our estimates on historical experience and on various other assumptions that are believed to be reasonable under the circumstances, the results of which form the basis for making judgments about the carrying values of assets and liabilities that are not readily apparent from other sources.&#160; These estimates have been consistently applied for all years presented in this report and in the past we have not experienced material differences between these estimates and actual results.&#160; However, because future events and their effects cannot be determined with certainty, actual results could differ from our estimates and such differences could be material.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have identified the policies below as critical to our business operations and to the understanding of our results of operations.&#160; For a detailed discussion of the application of these and other accounting policies, see <i>Note 1. Nature of Operations and Summary of Significant Accounting Policies,</i> in the Notes to our Consolidated Financial Statements.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Valuation of Goodwill, Long-Lived Assets,&nbsp;Intangible Assets and Equity and Cost Method Investments</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; We periodically evaluate our goodwill, broadcast licenses, long-lived assets, intangible assets and equity and cost method investments for potential impairment indicators.&#160; Our judgments regarding the existence of impairment indicators are based on estimated future cash flows, market conditions, operating performance of our stations and legal factors.&#160; Future events could cause us to conclude that impairment indicators exist and that the net book value of long-lived assets, intangible assets and equity and cost method investments is impaired.&#160; Any resulting impairment loss could have a material adverse impact on our consolidated balance sheets and consolidated statements of operations.</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">38<a name="PB_38_144347_2897"></a></font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='38',FILE='C:\JMS\rcheney\11-2081-1\task4533833\2081-1-ba-11.htm',USER='rcheney',CD='Mar  4 10:34 2011' -->

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#TableOfContents" title="Click to go to Table of Contents">Table of Contents</a></font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have determined our broadcast licenses to be indefinite-lived intangible assets in accordance with the accounting guidance for goodwill and other intangible assets, which requires such assets along with our goodwill to be tested for impairment on an annual basis or more often when certain triggering events occur.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2010, we had $660.0 million of goodwill, $47.4 million in broadcast licenses, and $184.7 million in definite-lived intangibles.&#160; We test our broadcast licenses and goodwill by estimating the fair market value of the broadcast licenses, or the fair value of our reporting units in the case of goodwill, using a combination of quoted market prices, observed earnings/cash flow multiples paid for comparable television stations, discounted cash flow models and appraisals.&#160; We then compare the estimated fair market value to the book value of these assets to determine if an impairment exists.&#160; We aggregate our stations by market for purposes of our goodwill and license impairment testing and we believe that our markets are most representative of our broadcast reporting units because we view, manage and evaluate our stations on a market basis.&#160; Furthermore, in our markets operated as duopolies, certain costs of operating the stations are shared including the use of buildings and equipment, the sales force and administrative personnel.&#160; Our discounted cash flow model is based on our judgment of future market conditions within each designated marketing area, as well as discount rates that would be used by market participants in an arms-length transaction.&#160; Future events could cause us to conclude that market conditions have declined or discount rates have increased to the extent that our broadcast licenses and/or goodwill could be impaired.&#160; Any resulting impairment loss could have a material adverse impact on our consolidated balance sheets, consolidated statements of operations and consolidated statements of cash flows.&#160; Based on assessments performed during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010, we recorded $4.8 million of impairment on our broadcast licenses and other assets, and during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 and 2008 we recorded $249.8 million and $463.9 million, respectively, in impairment losses on our goodwill, broadcast licenses and other assets.&#160; The impairment charge taken in 2008 was primarily due to the severe economic downturn during the fourth quarter, and as a result, we made downward revisions to forecasted cash flows, cash flow multiples and growth rates.&#160; Of the $249.8 million in impairment recorded in 2009, we recorded $130.1 million in the first quarter of 2009.&#160; We performed an interim impairment test in the first quarter of 2009 due to the severe economic downturn and continued decrease in our market capitalization.&#160; Accordingly, we made further revisions to our forecasted cash flows, cash flow multiples, and discount rates.&#160; The impairment charge taken during the fourth quarter of 2009 was primarily due to the continued deterioration of the economy which resulted in further decreases in our forecasted cash flows and increases in our discount rates.&#160; The $4.8 million impairment charge recorded in 2010 was primarily the result of additional cash outflows for increased signal strength necessary to maintain competitive market positions.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The implied value of our broadcast goodwill is calculated using a discounted cash flow model for 4 years and estimating the terminal value of the reporting units using a multiple of cash flows.&#160;&#160; The value of our broadcast licenses is calculated using a discounted cash flow model for eight years and estimating the terminal value based on the constant growth model and a compound annual growth rate.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The key assumptions used to determine the fair value of our reporting units to test our goodwill for impairment and to determine the fair value of our broadcast licenses consist of discount rates, revenue and expense growth rates, constant growth rates and comparable business multiples.&#160; The revenue and expense growth rates used in our goodwill impairment testing and the revenue, expense and constant growth rates used in determining the fair value of our broadcast licenses have decreased slightly from 2009 to 2010.&#160; However, the baseline cash flows to which these growth rates were applied have increased due to a stronger than expected recovery in revenue in 2010.&#160; The growth rates are based on market studies, industry knowledge and historical performance.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The discount rates used to determine the fair value of our reporting units to test our goodwill for impairment and to determine the fair value of our broadcast licenses have slightly decreased from 2009 to 2010.&#160; The discount rate is based on a number of factors including market interest rates, a weighted average cost of capital analysis based on the target capital structure for a television station, and includes adjustments for market risk and company specific risk.&#160; The decrease in the discount rate is primarily due to a slight decrease in the general cost of equity in 2010.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The comparable business multiple used to determine the fair value of our reporting units to test our goodwill for impairment has not changed from 2009 to 2010.&#160; Due to the lack of data from comparable sales transactions in the past two years, we estimated the multiple that would most likely be paid for a mature, cash flowing television station in the current marketplace.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">After taking the effect of the above mentioned impairment, as of December&nbsp;31, 2010, all of our reporting units tested for goodwill impairment had fair values that were greater than the carrying value by more than 10%.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010, an increase in our discount rate of 10% and/or a decrease in our multiple of 10% would not result in a goodwill impairment.&#160; An increase in our discount rate of greater than 89% or a decrease in our multiple of greater than 39% would likely cause reporting units to fail our Step 1 test for goodwill impairment and could lead to goodwill impairment.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">When factors indicate that there may be a decrease in value of an equity or cost method investment, we assess that investment and determine whether a loss in value has occurred.&#160; If that loss is deemed to be other than temporary an impairment loss is recorded.&#160; For any investments that indicate a potential impairment, we estimate the fair value of those investments using discounted cash flow models, unrelated third party valuations or industry comparables, based on the various facts available to us.</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">39<a name="PB_39_144451_3020"></a></font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='39',FILE='C:\JMS\rcheney\11-2081-1\task4533833\2081-1-ba-11.htm',USER='rcheney',CD='Mar  4 10:34 2011' -->

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#TableOfContents" title="Click to go to Table of Contents">Table of Contents</a></font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2010, we recorded $6.7 million of impairment on equity method investments.&#160; No impairment of our equity or cost method investments was recorded in 2009 or 2008.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Revenue Recognition</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; Advertising revenues, net of agency commissions, are recognized in the period during which commercials are aired.&#160; All other revenues are recognized as services are provided.&#160; The revenues realized from station barter arrangements are recorded as the programs are aired at the estimated fair value of the advertising airtime given in exchange for the program rights.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our retransmission consent agreements contain both advertising and retransmission consent elements that are paid in cash.&#160; We have determined that our agreements are revenue arrangements with multiple deliverables. &#160;Advertising and retransmission consent deliverables sold under our agreements are separated into different units of accounting based on fair value.&#160;&#160; Revenue applicable to the advertising element of the arrangement is recognized consistent with the advertising revenue policy noted above.&#160; Revenue applicable to the retransmission consent element of the arrangement is recognized ratably over the life of the agreement.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Allowance for Doubtful Accounts</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; We maintain an allowance for doubtful accounts for estimated losses resulting from extending credit to our customers that are unable to make required payments.&#160; If the economy and/or the financial condition of our customers were to deteriorate, resulting in an impairment of their ability to make payments, additional allowances may be required.&#160; For example, a 10% increase in the balance of our allowance for doubtful accounts as of December&nbsp;31, 2010, would increase bad debt expense by approximately $0.3 million.&#160; The allowance for doubtful accounts was $3.2 million and $2.9 million as of December&nbsp;31, 2010 and 2009, respectively.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Program Contract Costs</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; We have agreements with distributors for the rights to televise programming over contract periods, which generally run from one to seven years.&#160; Contract payments are made in installments over terms that are generally equal to or shorter than the contract period.&#160; Each contract is recorded as an asset and a liability at an amount equal to its gross cash contractual commitment when the license period begins and the program is available for its first showing.&#160; The portion of program contracts which become payable within one year is reflected as a current liability in the consolidated balance sheets. As of December&nbsp;31, 2010 and 2009, we recorded $45.7 million and $60.2 million, respectively, in program contract assets and $97.9 million and $140.4 million, respectively, in program contract liabilities.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The programming rights are reflected in the consolidated balance sheets at the lower of unamortized cost or estimated net realizable value (NRV).&#160; Estimated NRVs are based on management&#146;s expectation of future advertising revenue, net of sales commissions, to be generated by the remaining program material available under the contract terms.&#160; In conjunction with our NRV analysis of programming rights reflected in our consolidated balance sheets, we perform similar analysis on future programming rights yet to be reflected in our consolidated balance sheets and establish allowances when future payments exceed the estimated NRV.&#160; Amortization of program contract costs is generally computed using a four-year accelerated method or a straight-line method, depending on the length of the contract.&#160; Program contract costs estimated by management to be amortized within one year are classified as current assets.&#160; Program contract liabilities are typically paid on a scheduled basis and are not reflected by adjustments for amortization or estimated NRV.&#160; If our estimate of future advertising revenues declines, then additional write downs to NRV may be required.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Income Tax.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; We recognize deferred tax assets and liabilities based on the differences between the financial statements carrying amounts and the tax bases of assets and liabilities.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2010 and 2009, we recorded $9.7 million and $7.3 million, respectively, in deferred tax assets and $210.3 million and $169.5 million, respectively, in deferred tax liabilities.&#160; We provide a valuation allowance for deferred tax assets if we determine, based on the weight of all available evidence, that it is more likely than not that some or all of the deferred tax assets will not be realized.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2010, valuation allowances have been provided for a substantial amount of our available state net operating losses.&#160; Management periodically performs a comprehensive review of our tax positions and accrues amounts for tax contingencies.&#160; Based on these reviews, the status of ongoing audits and the expiration of applicable statute of limitations, accruals are adjusted as necessary in accordance with income tax accounting guidance.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Recent Accounting Pronouncements</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September&nbsp;2009, the Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB) ratified the Emerging Issues Task Force&#146;s (EITF&#146;s) amended guidance on accounting for revenue arrangements with multiple deliverables.&#160; The amended guidance allows the use of an estimated selling price for the undelivered units of accounting in transactions in which vendor-specific objective evidence (VSOE) or third-party evidence (TPE) does not exist.&#160; The amended guidance no longer allows the use of the residual method when allocating arrangement consideration between the delivered and undelivered units of accounting if VSOE and TPE of selling price does not exist for all units of accounting.&#160; Entities are required to estimate the selling price of the deliverables, when VSOE and TPE are not available, and then allocate the consideration based on the relative selling prices of the deliverables.&#160; This guidance also requires additional disclosures including the amount of revenue recognized each reporting period and the amount of deferred revenue as of the end of each reporting period under this guidance.&#160; This guidance is effective for revenue arrangements entered into or materially modified in fiscal years beginning after June&nbsp;15, 2010 and should be applied on a prospective basis.&#160; We do not believe that this guidance will have a material impact on our consolidated financial statements.</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">40<a name="PB_40_144507_7748"></a></font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='40',FILE='C:\JMS\rcheney\11-2081-1\task4533833\2081-1-ba-11.htm',USER='rcheney',CD='Mar  4 10:34 2011' -->

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#TableOfContents" title="Click to go to Table of Contents">Table of Contents</a></font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In January&nbsp;2010, the FASB amended the guidance on fair value measurements and disclosures to add two new disclosure provisions to the current fair value disclosure guidance, including (1)&nbsp;details of transfers in and out of level 1 and level 2 measurements, and (2)&nbsp;gross presentation of activity within the level 3 roll forward.&#160; The guidance also amends two existing fair value disclosure requirements so that entities are required to disclose (1)&nbsp;the valuation techniques and inputs used to develop fair value measurements for assets and liabilities that are measured at fair value on both a recurring basis and nonrecurring basis in periods subsequent to initial recognition and (2)&nbsp;fair value measurement disclosures for each class of assets and liabilities.&#160; A class is defined as a subset of assets or liabilities within a line item in the statement of financial position.&#160; The guidance is for interim and annual reporting periods beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2009, except for the changes to the level 3 roll forward which are effective for fiscal years beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2010.&#160; We added the required disclosures under this guidance to our consolidated financial statements.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In November&nbsp;2010, the FASB ratified the EITF&#146;s amended guidance with respect to goodwill impairment.&#160;&#160; The amended guidance requires that step two of the goodwill impairment test be performed if the carrying amount of a reporting unit is zero or negative and it is more likely than not that a goodwill impairment exists based on any adverse qualitative factors including an evaluation of the triggering circumstances noted in the guidance.&#160; The change is effective for fiscal years and interim changes within those years beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2010.&#160; We do not believe that this guidance will have a material impact on our consolidated financial statements.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">RESULTS OF OPERATIONS</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In general, this discussion is related to the results of our continuing operations, except for discussions regarding our cash flows, which also include the results of our discontinued operations.&#160; Unless otherwise indicated, references in this discussion to 2010, 2009 and 2008 are to our fiscal years ended December&nbsp;31, 2010, 2009 and 2008, respectively.&#160; Additionally, any references to the first, second, third or fourth quarters are to the three months ended March&nbsp;31, June&nbsp;30, September&nbsp;30 and December&nbsp;31, respectively, for the year being discussed.&#160;&#160; We have two reportable segments, &#147;broadcast&#148; and &#147;other operating divisions&#148; that are disclosed separately from our corporate activities.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Seasonality/Cyclicality</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our operating results are usually subject to seasonal fluctuations.&#160; Usually, the second and fourth quarter operating results are higher than the first and third quarters because advertising expenditures are increased in anticipation of certain seasonal and holiday spending by consumers.&#160; The negative financial and economic conditions effected the usual seasonal fluctuations in 2009.&#160; In 2010, as the economy started to stabilize and recover, our seasonal fluctuations returned to normal.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our operating results are usually subject to fluctuations from political advertising.&#160; In even numbered years, political spending is usually significantly higher than in odd numbered years due to advertising expenditures preceding local and national elections.&#160; Additionally, every four years, political spending is elevated further due to advertising expenditures preceding the presidential election.&#160; Due to the contentious mid-term elections our political revenues in 2010 not only exceeded 2006 results, but exceeded 2008 presidential election year revenues as well.</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">41<a name="PB_41_144512_141"></a></font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>
</div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#TableOfContents" title="Click to go to Table of Contents">Table of Contents</a></font></p>

Selected Financial Data</i>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Political revenue is not comparable from year to year due to the cyclicality of elections.&#160; See <i>Political Revenues</i> below for more information.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our largest categories of advertising and their approximate percentages of 2010 net time sales, which includes the advertising portion of our local and national revenues, were automotive (17.9%), professional services (15.5%), political (8.0%), schools (7.7%) and fast food (6.2%).&#160; No other advertising category accounted for more than 5.0% of our net time sales in 2010.&#160; No advertiser accounted for more than 1.0% of our consolidated revenue in 2010.&#160; We conduct business with thousands of advertisers.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our primary types of programming and their approximate percentages of 2010 net time sales were syndicated programming (41.1%), network programming (25.2%), news (20.0%), sports programming (7.4%) and direct advertising programming (6.3%).</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">42<a name="PB_42_144828_7608"></a></font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>
</div>
