<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.86%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>    </td>
<td width="15%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:15.28%;">
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">184,652</font></p>    </td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.38%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>   </tr>  </table>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">5.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTES PAYABLE AND COMMERCIAL BANK FINANCING:</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Bank Credit Agreement</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On October&nbsp;29, 2009, concurrently with the closing of the offering of the 9.25% Notes we entered into the Bank Credit Agreement by amending and restating the previous bank credit agreement.&#160; On August&nbsp;19, 2010, we entered into an amendment (the Amendment) of our Bank Credit Agreement.&#160; The final terms of the Bank Credit Agreement, as amended, are set forth below:</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 45.0pt;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A six-year term loan facility (Term Loan B) of $330.0 million.&#160; Under the Amendment, we paid down $35.0 million of the outstanding $305.0 million balance under the Term Loan B and repriced the remaining $270.0 million outstanding.&#160; The Term Loan B bears interest at LIBOR plus 4.00% with a 1.5% LIBOR floor and will continue to amortize principal at a rate of 0.25% per quarter commencing on March&nbsp;31, 2011, continuing until the scheduled final payment on October&nbsp;29, 2015 with 94.19% due at maturity or upon earlier termination of the Term Loan B pursuant to the terms in the Bank Credit Agreement.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 45.0pt;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have the right to prepay the Term Loan B at any time; provided, however, that if we prepay, reprice downward or otherwise refinance all or any portion of the Term Loan B prior to August&nbsp;19, 2011, then we will be required to pay the Term Loan B lenders a prepayment premium equal to 1.00% of the aggregate amount prepaid, repriced or otherwise refinanced.&#160; Any prepayments on the Term Loan B are deducted from the scheduled final payment due on October&nbsp;29, 2015.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 45.0pt;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">An amended and restated revolving credit facility (the Revolving Credit Facility).&#160; Under the terms of the Revolving Credit Facility, $60.5 million in existing commitments will remain in place under the revolving credit facility pricing in the previous bank credit agreement, which as of December&nbsp;31, 2010 was LIBOR plus 0.75% and will expire June&nbsp;2011.&#160; In addition, $75.4 million in commitments were extended until December&nbsp;31, 2013 at a price of LIBOR plus 4.00% with a 2.0% LIBOR floor.&#160; We have the right to prepay the Revolving Credit Facility at any time without prepayment penalty.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2010, we did not have any amounts drawn under the Revolving Credit Facility.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 45.0pt;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Provision for additional incremental term loan capacity up to $100.0 million.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 45.0pt;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Bank Credit Agreement is collateralized by $1,001.8 million of our tangible and intangible assets.</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-23<a name="PB_23_152122_7608"></a></font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-23',FILE='C:\JMS\C900708\11-2081-1\task4532518\2081-1-ba-27.htm',USER='c900708',CD='Mar  4 07:47 2011' -->

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#TableOfContents" title="Click to go to Table of Contents">Table of Contents</a></font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2010, debt refinancing costs of $3.6 million were recorded to interest expense in our consolidated statement of operations in accordance with debt modification accounting guidance that applied to the amendment.&#160; Interest expense, excluding the debt refinancing costs, was $19.9 million, $8.5 million and $14.1 million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2010, 2009 and 2008, respectively.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The weighted average interest rate of the Term Loan B for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2010 and 2009 was 6.86% and 6.96%, respectively.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In February&nbsp;2011, we disclosed our intention to refinance a portion of and to amend certain terms of the Bank Credit Agreement.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">8.0% Senior Subordinated Notes, Due 2012</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">From March&nbsp;2002 through May&nbsp;29, 2003, we issued $650.0 million aggregate principal amount of 8.0% Senior Subordinated Notes, due 2012 (the 8.0% Notes).&#160; Interest on the 8.0% Notes was paid semiannually on March&nbsp;15 and September&nbsp;15 of each year, beginning September&nbsp;15, 2002.&#160; The 8.0% Notes were issued under an indenture among us, certain of our subsidiaries (the guarantors) and the trustee.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition to partial redemptions in 2007, during 2008, we repurchased, in the open market, $38.8 million of the 8.0% Notes at face value.&#160; As a result of these redemptions, we recorded a gain from extinguishment of debt of $0.4 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008.&#160; We did not repurchase any 8.0% Notes in 2009.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On September&nbsp;20, 2010, we commenced a tender offer to purchase for cash any and all of the outstanding 8.0% Notes.&#160; We offered to purchase the 8.0% Notes at a purchase price of $1,002.50 per $1,000 principal amount, if tendered within the first ten business days of the tender offer period or $972.50 per $1,000 principal amount if tendered after such time, plus accrued and unpaid interest.&#160; The tender offers expired October&nbsp;19, 2010 and approximately $175.7 million principal amount of the 8.0% Notes were tendered and purchased.&#160; On November&nbsp;19, 2010, we completed the redemption of the remaining $49.0 million outstanding of 8.0% Notes.&#160; These Notes were redeemed for cash at a redemption price of 100% of the principal amount of the Notes plus accrued and unpaid interest.&#160; The redemption of the Notes was effected in accordance with the terms of the indenture governing the Notes and was funded from the net proceeds of the 8.375% Senior Unsecured Notes, due 2018 (8.375% Notes) offering described below and available cash on hand.&#160; As a result of these redemptions, we recorded a gain from extinguishment of debt of $0.7 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest expense was $13.9 million, $17.6 million and $19.4 million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2010, 2009 and 2008, respectively.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The weighted average interest rate for the 8.0% Notes including the amortization of its bond premium was 7.88% and 7.83% for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2010 and 2009, respectively.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">6.0% Convertible Debentures, Due 2012</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On June&nbsp;15, 2005, we completed an exchange of our Series&nbsp;D Convertible Exchangeable Preferred Stock (the Preferred Stock) into 6.0 % Convertible Debentures, due 2012 (the 6.0% Notes).&#160; The 6.0% Notes mature September&nbsp;15, 2012, and bear interest at a rate of 6.0% per annum, payable quarterly on each March&nbsp;15, June&nbsp;15, September&nbsp;15 and December&nbsp;15, beginning September&nbsp;15, 2005.&#160; The 6.0% Notes are convertible into Class&nbsp;A Common Stock at the option of the holders at a conversion price of $22.813 per share, subject to adjustment.&#160; The difference in the carrying amount of the Preferred Stock and the fair value of the 6.0% Notes was recorded as a $31.7 million discount on the 6.0% Notes and is being amortized over the life of the 6.0% Notes using the effective interest method.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2009 and 2008, we redeemed, on the open market, $1.0 million and $18.1 million principal amount of the 6.0% Notes.&#160; In connection with these redemptions, we recorded a gain from extinguishment of debt of $0.4 million and $2.2 million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 and 2008, respectively.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2010, we repurchased, on the open market, $6.1 million in principal amount of the 6.0% Notes.&#160; On September&nbsp;20, 2010, we commenced tender offers to purchase for cash up to $60.0 million in principal amount of the outstanding 6.0% Notes.&#160; We offered to purchase the 6.0% Notes at a purchase price of $987.50 per $1,000 principal amount plus accrued and unpaid interest.&#160; The tender offer expired October&nbsp;19, 2010 and approximately $58.0 million of the 6.0% Notes were tendered and purchased.&#160; The net proceeds from the offering of the 8.375% Notes described below and cash on hand were used to fund this tender offer.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest expense was $10.6 million, $11.6 million, and $9.0 million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2010, 2009 and 2008, respectively.</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-24<a name="PB_24_152150_8146"></a></font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-24',FILE='C:\JMS\C900708\11-2081-1\task4532518\2081-1-ba-27.htm',USER='c900708',CD='Mar  4 07:47 2011' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#TableOfContents" title="Click to go to Table of Contents">Table of Contents</a></font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The weighted average interest rate for the 6.0% Notes including the amortization of its bond discount was 8.96% and 8.65% for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2010 and 2009, respectively.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">9.25% Senior Secured Second Lien Notes, Due 2017</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On October&nbsp;29, 2009, we issued $500.0 million aggregate principal amount of the 9.25% Notes that mature on November&nbsp;1, 2017, pursuant to an indenture, dated as of October&nbsp;29, 2009 (the Indenture).&#160; The 9.25% Notes were priced at 97.264% of their par value and accrue interest at a rate of 9.25% beginning on the issue date.&#160; Interest on the 9.25% Notes is paid on May&nbsp;1 and November&nbsp;1 of each year, beginning May&nbsp;1, 2010.&#160; Prior to November&nbsp;1, 2013, we may redeem the 9.25% Notes in whole, but not in part, at any time at a price equal to 100% of the principal amount of the 9.25% Notes plus accrued and unpaid interest, plus a &#147;make-whole premium&#148; as set forth in the Indenture.&#160; Beginning on November&nbsp;1, 2013, we may redeem some or all of the 9.25% Notes at any time or from time to time at the redemption prices set forth in the Indenture.&#160; In addition, on or prior to November&nbsp;1, 2012, we may redeem up to 35.0% of the 9.25% Notes using the proceeds of certain equity offerings.&#160; Upon the sale of certain of our assets or certain changes of control, the holders of the 9.25% Notes may require us to repurchase some or all of the 9.25% Notes.&#160; The 9.25% Notes are collateralized by $1,001.8 million of our tangible and intangible assets.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The weighted average interest rate for the 9.25% Notes including the amortization of its bond discount was 9.71% and 9.72% for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2010 and 2009, respectively.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest expense was $47.3 million and $8.3 million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2010 and 2009, respectively.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">8.375% Senior Unsecured Notes, due 2018</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On October&nbsp;4, 2010, we issued $250.0 million aggregate principal amount of 8.375% Notes due October&nbsp;15, 2018 at 98.567% of their par value pursuant to an indenture, dated as of October&nbsp;4, 2010 (the Indenture).&#160; Interest on the 8.375% Notes will be paid on April&nbsp;15 and October&nbsp;15 of each year, beginning April&nbsp;15, 2011.&#160; Prior to October&nbsp;15, 2014, we may redeem the 8.375% Notes in whole or in part, at any time or from time to time at a price equal to 100% of the principal amount of the 8.375% Notes plus accrued and unpaid interest, plus a &#147;make-whole premium&#148; as set forth in the Indenture.&#160; Beginning on October&nbsp;15, 2014, we may redeem some or all of the 8.375% Notes at any time or from time to time at the redemption prices set forth in the Indenture.&#160; In addition, on or prior to October&nbsp;15, 2013, we may redeem up to 35% of the 8.375% Notes using the proceeds of certain equity offerings.&#160; Upon certain changes of control, we must offer to purchase the 8.375% Notes at a price equal to 101% of the face amount of the Notes plus accrued and unpaid interest.&#160; The net proceeds from the offering of the 8.375% Notes were used to fund the tender offers for our 6.0% and 8.0% Notes described above.&#160; Concurrent to entering into the Indenture we also entered into a registration rights agreement requiring us to complete an offer of an exchange of the 8.375% Notes for registered securities with the SEC by July&nbsp;1, 2011.&#160; The 8.375% Notes registration became effective on November&nbsp;23, 2010.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The weighted average interest rate of the 8.375% Notes for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010 was 8.45%.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest expense was $5.1 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">4.875% Convertible Senior Notes, Due 2018 and 3.0% Convertible Senior Notes, Due 2027</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Any holder of the 4.875% Notes may surrender all or any portion of their notes for a conversion into our Class&nbsp;A Common Stock at any time. As of December&nbsp;31, 2010, the conversion price of the 4.875% Notes was $22.37 per share and the number of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock that would be delivered upon conversion was 254,128.&#160; The 4.875% Notes bore cash interest at an annual rate of 4.875% until January&nbsp;15, 2011 and now bear cash interest at an annual rate of 2.00% from January&nbsp;15, 2011 through maturity.&#160; The principal amount of the 4.875% Notes will accrete to 125.66% of the original par amount from January&nbsp;15, 2011 to maturity.&#160; As of January&nbsp;15, 2011, no put rights were exercised for the 4.875% Notes and the put right expired.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Upon certain conditions, the 3.0% Notes are convertible into cash and, in certain circumstances, shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock at any time on or before November&nbsp;15, 2026.&#160; Holders of the 3.0% Notes will have the right on May&nbsp;15, 2017 and May&nbsp;15, 2022, or any other such date to be determined by us at a repurchase price payable in cash equal to the aggregate principal amount plus accrued and unpaid interest (including contingent cash interest), if any, through the repurchase date. As of December&nbsp;31, 2010, the conversion price of the 3.0% Notes was $18.99 per share and the number of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock that would be delivered upon conversion was 284,360.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2008, we redeemed, on the open market, $6.5 million of the 4.875% Notes.&#160; We recorded a $2.8 million gain on extinguishment of debt related to this redemption for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008.</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-25<a name="PB_F_145951_7056"></a></font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-25',FILE='C:\JMS\mfranka\11-2081-1\task4533572\2081-1-ba-29.htm',USER='mfranka',CD='Mar  4 07:22 2011' -->

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#TableOfContents" title="Click to go to Table of Contents">Table of Contents</a></font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2009, we commenced tender offers at 98% of the face value of the Notes and purchased $266.6 million and $106.5 million of the 3.0% Notes and 4.875% Notes, respectively.&#160; Additionally, during 2009, we redeemed, on the open market, $50.7 million of the 3.0% Notes.&#160; We recorded $18.9 million and $0.2 million gain from extinguishment on the 3.0% Notes and 4.875% Notes, respectively for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009.</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the first quarter of 2010, we completed tender offers to purchase for cash any and all of the outstanding 3.0% Notes and 4.875% Notes at 100% of the face value of such notes.&#160; We redeemed approximately $12.3 million and $14.3 million of the 3.0% and 4.875% Notes, respectively.&#160; During the second quarter of 2010, the put right period for the 3.0% Notes expired and holders representing $10.0 million in principal amount of the 3.0% Notes exercised their put rights.&#160; During the third quarter of 2010, we redeemed $17.0 million of the 4.875% Notes in a private transaction.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The weighted average interest rate for the 4.875% Notes was 4.875% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009.&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The effective interest rate on the liability portion of the 3.0% Notes at December&nbsp;31, 2009 was 6.35%.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest expense for the 4.875% Notes was $1.0 million, $6.2 million and $7.3 million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2010, 2009 and 2008, respectively.&#160; Interest expense for the 3.0% Notes was $0.5 million, $15.5 million and $20.5 million, respectively.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Cunningham Bank Credit Facility</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cunningham, one of our consolidated VIEs, holds a $33.5 million term loan facility originally entered into on March&nbsp;20, 2002, with an unrelated third party.&nbsp; Primarily all of Cunningham&#146;s assets are collateral for its term loan facility, which is non-recourse.&#160; On June&nbsp;5, 2009, the administrative agent under Cunningham&#146;s bank credit facility declared an event of default under the facility for failure to timely deliver certain annual financial statements as required.&nbsp; As of such date, a rate of interest of LIBOR plus 5.0%, which rate includes a 2.0% default rate of interest, was instituted on all outstanding borrowings under the Cunningham bank credit facility.&nbsp; On June&nbsp;30, 2009, the default was waived and the termination date of the Cunningham bank credit facility was extended to July&nbsp;31, 2009, subject to certain conditions, including maintaining the default interest rate.&nbsp; On July&nbsp;31, 2009, the Cunningham bank credit facility was further extended to October&nbsp;30, 2009. The extension required that Cunningham make $0.2 million principal payments on its term loan facility as of the first day of each of August, September&nbsp;and October&nbsp;with the balance due on October&nbsp;30, 2009.&nbsp; To avoid any potential bankruptcy of Cunningham, the lenders under Cunningham&#146;s existing credit facility indicated their willingness to replace such credit facility with a new credit facility, which was conditioned upon Cunningham&#146;s demonstration that it can repay the outstanding principal balance due under the facility within three years maturing on October&nbsp;1, 2012.&nbsp; The interest rate of the new credit facility is LIBOR plus 4.5% with a 2.0% floor.&#160; As a result, Cunningham asked us to restructure certain of its arrangements with us, including the LMAs.&#160; See <i>Note 11.</i>  <i>Related Person Transactions</i> for more information.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our Bank Credit Agreement contains certain cross-default provisions with certain material third-party licensees.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2010, Cunningham was the sole material third party licensee as defined in our Bank Credit Agreement.&#160; A default by a material third-party licensee including a default caused by insolvency would cause an event of default under our Bank Credit Agreement.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2010, 2009 and 2008, the interest expense relating to Cunningham&#146;s term loan facility was $1.7 million, $1.8 million and $2.0 million, respectively.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Other Operating Divisions Segment Debt</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other operating divisions segment debt includes the debt of our consolidated subsidiaries with non-broadcast related operations.&#160; This debt is non-recourse.&#160; Interest is paid on this debt at rates typically ranging from LIBOR plus 2.75% to a fixed 6.11% during 2010.&#160; During 2010, 2009 and 2008, interest expense on this debt was $4.3 million, $3.8 million and $1.0 million, respectively.</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-26<a name="PB_F_150033_5335"></a></font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>
</div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Indebtedness under the notes payable, capital leases and the Bank Credit Agreement as of December&nbsp;31, 2010 matures as follows (in thousands):</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Substantially all of our stock in our wholly-owned subsidiaries has been pledged as security for the Bank Credit Agreement.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December&nbsp;31, 2010, our broadcast segment had 28 capital leases with non-affiliates, including 26 tower leases and two building leases; our other operating divisions segment had 2 capital equipment leases and corporate has one building lease.&#160; All of our tower leases will expire within the next 22 years and the building lease will expire within the next 7 years.&#160; Most of our leases have 5-10 year renewal options and it is expected that these leases will be renewed or replaced within the normal course of business.&#160; For more information related to our affiliate notes and capital leases, see <i>Note 11.</i>  <i>Related Person Transactions</i>.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We filed a $500.0 million universal shelf registration statement with the SEC which became effective April&nbsp;22, 2009 and expires March&nbsp;8, 2012.&#160; We may use the universal shelf registration statement to issue common and preferred equity, debt securities and securities convertible into equity.</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-27<a name="PB_F_150257_5796"></a></font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>    </td>   </tr>
<tr>
<td width="75%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:75.52%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Long-term portion of program contracts payable</font></p>    </td>
<td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.92%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.38%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>    </td>
<td width="17%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:17.62%;">
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">29,593</font></p>    </td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.56%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>   </tr>  </table>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Each future periods&#146; film liability includes contractual amounts owed, however, what is contractually owed does not necessarily reflect what we are expected to pay during that period.&#160; While we are contractually bound to make the payments reflected in the table during the indicated periods, industry protocol typically enables us to make film payments on a three-month lag.&#160; Included in the current portion amounts are payments due in arrears of $18.5 million.&#160; In addition, we have entered into non-cancelable commitments for future program rights aggregating $88.5 million as of December&nbsp;31, 2010.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We perform a net realizable value calculation quarterly for each of our program contract costs in accordance with FASB guidance on Financial Reporting for Broadcasters.&#160; We utilize sales information to estimate the future revenue of each commitment and measure that amount against the commitment.&#160; If the estimated future revenue is less than the amount of the commitment, a loss is recorded in amortization of program contract costs and net realizable value adjustments in the consolidated statements of operations.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">7.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">COMMON STOCK:</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Holders of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock are entitled to one vote per share and holders of Class&nbsp;B Common Stock are entitled to ten votes per share, except for votes relating to &#147;going private&#148; and certain other transactions.&#160; The Class&nbsp;A Common Stock and the Class&nbsp;B Common Stock vote together as a single class, except as otherwise may be required by Maryland law, on all matters presented for a vote.&#160; Holders of Class&nbsp;B Common Stock may at any time convert their shares into the same number of shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock.&#160; During 2010 and 2009, 2,370,040 and 2,000,000, respectively, Class&nbsp;B Common Stock shares were converted into Class&nbsp;A Common Stock shares.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our Bank Credit Agreement and some of our subordinated debt instruments have restrictions on our ability to pay dividends.&#160; Under our Bank Credit Agreement, in certain circumstances, we may make up to $40.0 million in unrestricted annual cash payments including but not limited to dividends.&#160; Under the indentures governing the 9.25% Notes and 8.375% Notes, we are restricted from paying dividends on our common stock unless certain specified conditions are satisfied, including that:</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">no event of default then exists under the indenture or certain other specified agreements relating to our indebtedness; and</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">after taking into account the dividends payment, we are within certain restricted payment requirements contained in the indenture.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, under certain of our debt instruments, the payment of dividends is not permissible during a default thereunder.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">No dividend payments were made in 2009.&#160; In November&nbsp;2010, our Board of Directors declared a $0.43 per share common stock dividend.&#160; The dividend was paid on December&nbsp;15, 2010 to holders of record on December&nbsp;1, 2010.&#160; In February&nbsp;2011, our Board of Directors reinstated our dividend policy, declaring a quarterly common stock dividend of $0.12 per share.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On February&nbsp;5, 2008, our Board of Directors renewed its authorization to repurchase up to $150.0 million of the Class&nbsp;A Common Stock on the open market or through private transactions.&#160; During 2009, we repurchased approximately 1.5 million shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock for approximately $1.5 million on the open market, including transaction cost.&#160; We did not repurchase any shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock during 2010.</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-28<a name="PB_F_150552_2897"></a></font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-28',FILE='C:\JMS\mfranka\11-2081-1\task4533572\2081-1-ba-29.htm',USER='mfranka',CD='Mar  4 07:22 2011' -->

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#TableOfContents" title="Click to go to Table of Contents">Table of Contents</a></font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">8.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">DERIVATIVE INSTRUMENTS:</font></b></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We enter into derivative instruments primarily to reduce the impact of changing interest rates on our floating rate debt and to reduce the impact of changing fair market values on our fixed rate debt.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In February&nbsp;2008, the counterparty to our then existing interest rate swap agreements, elected to change the termination dates of the $180.0 million and $120.0 million swaps from March&nbsp;15, 2012 to March&nbsp;25, 2008 and March&nbsp;26, 2008, respectively.&#160; We received a termination fee of $3.2 million from the counterparty for the early termination of the $120.0 million swap.&#160; After the removal of the related $2.4 million derivative asset from our consolidated balance sheet, the resulting $0.8 million, along with $0.2 million of interest was recorded in gain from derivative instruments in the consolidated statements of operations.&#160; We received a termination fee of $4.8 million from the counterparty for the early termination of the $180.0 million swap.&#160; The carrying value of the underlying debt was adjusted to reflect the $4.8 million termination fee and that amount was treated as a premium on the underlying debt that was being hedged and is amortized over its remaining life as a reduction to interest expense.&#160; The total termination fees received of $8.0 million are included in the cash flows from financing activities section of the consolidated statement of cash flows for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December&nbsp;31, 2010, we have embedded derivatives related to contingent cash interest features in our 4.875% Notes and 3.0% Notes, which had negligible fair values.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">9.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">INCOME TAXES:</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The provision (benefit) for income taxes consisted of the following for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2010, 2009 and 2008 (in thousands):</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(32,162</font></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 1.125pt 0in;width:2.5%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>    </td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>    </td>
<td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.7%;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following is a reconciliation of federal income taxes at the applicable statutory rate to the recorded provision from continuing operations:</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
<tr>
<td width="52%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:52.5%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The non-deductible expense items include the tax effect of $27.9 million and $5.4 million of non-deductible goodwill impairment for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 and 2008, respectively, and $0.1 million, $2.0 million and $8.3 million of non-deductible FCC license impairment for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2010, 2009 and 2008, respectively.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-29<a name="PB_F_150939_3020"></a></font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#TableOfContents" title="Click to go to Table of Contents">Table of Contents</a></font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We recorded a deferred tax benefit of $2.5 million and $3.8 million during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2010 and 2009, respectively, related to the recovery of historical losses attributable to the basis in stock of certain subsidiaries.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Temporary differences between the financial reporting carrying amounts and the tax bases of assets and liabilities give rise to deferred taxes.&#160; Total deferred tax assets and deferred tax liabilities as of December&nbsp;31, 2010 and 2009 were as follows (in thousands):</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="83%" style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:.25in;width:83.32%;">
<tr>
<td width="64%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:64.0%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.0%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="14%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.42%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2010</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.0%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="14%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.42%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2009</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.16%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>   </tr>
<tr>
<td width="64%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:64.0%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Current and Long-Term Deferred Tax Assets:</font></p>    </td>
<td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.0%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>
<td width="14%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.42%;">

<td width="64%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:64.0%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net tax liabilities</font></p>    </td>
<td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.0%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>    </td>
<td width="13%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.12%;">
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(200,677</font></p>    </td>
<td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 2.25pt 0in;width:3.0%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>    </td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>    </td>
<td width="13%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.12%;">
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(162,250</font></p>    </td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 2.25pt 0in;width:1.16%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>    </td>   </tr>  </table>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our remaining federal and state net operating losses will expire during various years from 2011 to 2030.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We establish valuation allowances in accordance with the guidance related to accounting for income taxes.&#160; In evaluating our ability to realize net deferred tax assets, we consider all available evidence, both positive and negative, including our past operating results, tax planning strategies and forecasts of future taxable income.&#160; In considering these sources of taxable income, we must make certain assumptions and judgments that are based on the plans and estimates used to manage our underlying businesses. A valuation allowance has been provided for deferred tax assets based on past operating results, expected timing of the reversals of existing temporary book/tax basis differences, alternative tax strategies and projected future taxable income.&#160; Although realization is not assured for the remaining deferred tax assets, we believe it is more likely than not that they will be realized in the future.&#160; During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010, we increased our valuation allowance by $0.7 million.&#160; The change in valuation allowance was primarily due to state net operating losses.&#160; During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, we decreased our valuation allowances by $8.0 million.&#160; The change in valuation allowance was primarily due to the removal of the fully valued federal net operating losses related to the closure of a subsidiary.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December&nbsp;31, 2010 and 2009, we had $26.1 million of gross unrecognized tax benefits.&#160; Of this total, $15.1 million (net of federal effect on state tax issues) and $6.8 million (net of federal effect on state tax issues) represent the amounts of unrecognized tax benefits that, if recognized, would favorably affect our effective tax rates from continuing operations and discontinued operations, respectively.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table summarizes the activity related to our accrued unrecognized tax benefits (in thousands):</font></p>

<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.58%;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-30<a name="PB_F_151252_7748"></a></font></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-30',FILE='C:\JMS\mfranka\11-2081-1\task4533572\2081-1-ba-29.htm',USER='mfranka',CD='Mar  4 07:22 2011' -->

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#TableOfContents" title="Click to go to Table of Contents">Table of Contents</a></font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, we recognize accrued interest and penalties related to unrecognized tax benefits in income tax expense.&#160; We recognized $1.0 million, $1.1 million and $1.4 million of income tax expense for interest related to uncertain tax positions for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2010, 2009 and 2008, respectively.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Management periodically performs a comprehensive review of our tax positions and accrues amounts for tax contingencies.&#160; Based on these reviews, the status of on-going audits and the expiration of applicable statute of limitations, these accruals are adjusted as necessary.&#160; The resolution of audits is unpredictable and could result in tax liabilities that are significantly higher or lower than for what we have provided.&#160; Amounts accrued for these tax matters are included in the table above and long-term liabilities in our consolidated balance sheets.&#160; We believe that adequate accruals have been provided for all years.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We are subject to U.S. federal income tax as well as income tax of multiple state jurisdictions.&#160; All of our 2007 and subsequent federal and state tax returns remain subject to examination by various tax authorities.&#160; Some of our pre-2007 federal and state tax returns may also be subject to examination.&#160; In addition, our 2006 and 2007 federal tax returns are currently under audit, and several of our subsidiaries are currently under state examinations for various years.&#160; We do not anticipate the resolution of these matters will result in a material change to our consolidated financial statements.&#160; In addition, it is reasonably possible that various statutes of limitations could expire by December&nbsp;31, 2011.&#160; We do not expect such expirations, if any, would significantly change our unrecognized tax benefits over the next twelve months.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">10.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">COMMITMENTS AND CONTINGENCIES:</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 27.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Litigation</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We are a party to lawsuits and claims from time to time in the ordinary course of business.&#160; Actions currently pending are in various stages and no material judgments or decisions have been rendered by hearing boards or courts in connection with such actions.&#160; After reviewing developments to date with legal counsel, our management is of the opinion that the outcome of our pending and threatened matters will not have a material adverse effect on our consolidated balance sheets, consolidated statements of operations or consolidated statements of cash flows.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Various parties have filed petitions to deny our applications for the following stations&#146; license renewals: &#160;WXLV-TV, Winston-Salem, North Carolina; WMYV-TV, Greensboro, North Carolina; WLFL-TV, Raleigh/Durham, North Carolina; WRDC-TV, Raleigh/Durham, North Carolina; WLOS-TV, Asheville, North Carolina, WMMP-TV, Charleston, South Carolina; WTAT-TV, Charleston, South Carolina; WMYA-TV, Anderson, South Carolina; WICS-TV and WICD-TV in Springfield/Champaign,&nbsp;Illinois and WCGV-TV and WVTV-TV in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.&#160; The FCC is in the process of considering the renewal applications and we believe the petitions have no merit.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Operating Leases</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have entered into operating leases for certain property and equipment under terms ranging from one to 15 years.&#160; The rent expense from continuing operations under these leases, as well as certain leases under month-to-month arrangements, for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2010, 2009 and 2008 was approximately $3.7 million, $4.1 million and $4.3 million, respectively.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Future minimum payments under the leases are as follows (in thousands):</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
